portion.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a part of something larger, especially a part that is different from the other parts
portion.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The main character’s childhood takes up a good portion of the film.
The front portion of the rocket breaks off.
The rent on his portion of the apartment was $500 a month.
portion.translation[0].definitions[1].de: an amount of food for one person, especially when served in a restaurant
portion.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Do you have any children’s portions?
He served generous portions  (=large portions) of soup from a black pot.
a huge portion of roast beef
portion.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a share of something, such as responsibility, blame, or a duty, that is divided between a small number of people
portion.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The other driver must bear a portion of the blame for the accident.
portion.translation[0].note_box[0].headi: – Meaning 1: a part of something larger, especially a part that is different from the other parts
portion.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: Temperatures over a large portion of the central and eastern states were well below normal.
He owns a substantial portion of the company.
This bonus constitutes a significant portion of their total income.
She spends a good portion of her paycheck on clothes and entertainment.
A small portion of western Croatia remained under Habsburg control.
portion.translation[0].note_box[1].headi: – Meaning 2: an amount of food for one person, especially when served in a restaurant
portion.translation[0].note_box[1].secti: I was hungry so I asked for a large portion of french fries.
Spoon a generous portion of the sauce over the pasta.
One way of losing weight is to eat smaller portions.
I ordered a double portion of chicken.
